intro: Bernardina lobelina, commonly known as the Lobel's bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes various bellflowers and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. It typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its ornamental value has made it a sought-after plant in botanical gardens and specialized horticulture.
